quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Duet and Elvis Presley
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, harris, jackson. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: “Man, I was tame compared to what they do now. Are you kidding? I didn’t do anything but just jiggle.”

options.text: what famous venue were these words uttered by Elvis Presley?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Madison Square Garden

questions.question: All the Roadrunning is a collaborative album by Elton John and Emmylou Harris.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Emmylou Harris and Linda Ronstadt did a duet before forming a trio with Dolly Parton.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Mary Chapin Carpenter did a duet on the famous folk tune Diamonds and Rust with this legendary folk singer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joan Baez

questions.question: Which was the first duo to sing Were Not the Jet Set?

options.text: Whisperin Bill Anderson and Connie Smith

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Jones and Tammy Wynette

questions.question: Where was Elvis Presley, The King of Rock born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tupelo, Mississippi

questions.question: Which couple sang the song Jackson?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johnny Cash and June Carter

questions.question: On the Milton Berle Show, Elvis Presley caused a scandal with what song?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hound Dog

questions.question: Storms Never Last was a duet performed by this couple.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Waylon Jennings and Jessi Colter

questions.question: How many Grammy Awards did Elvis Presley receive throughout his career?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 3

questions.question: Which country singer originally recorded the song Picture with Kid Rock?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Allison Moorer

questions.question: Walkaway Joe was a duet featuring Trisha Yearwood and this singer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Don Henley

questions.question: Which duo recorded the song Seven Spanish Angels?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ray Charles and Willie Nelson

questions.question: When was Elvis Presley officially discharged from military service?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1960

questions.question: Which two singers had a hit with The Whiskey Aint Workin No More?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Travis Tritt and Marty Stuart

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Line
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, gon, impresario. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: We get groovin when the sun goes down is a line from which single by Neil Diamond?

options.text: I Thank the Lord for the Night Time

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I Thank the Lord for the Night Time

questions.question: Which 1965 hit opens with the line Ive got sunshine on a cloudy day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: My Girl

questions.question: What was the debut album of Elvis Presleys daughter, Lisa Marie Presley?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To Whom It May Concern

questions.question: What was Elvis Presleys favorite sandwich?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peanut butter and banana sandwich

questions.question: You are the sun, I am the moon is a line from which song by Neil Diamond?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Play Me

questions.question: The line I get my kicks above the waistline, sunshine is from which song by Murray Head?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: One Night in Bangkok

questions.question: Which song from the 1987 album Kick includes the following lyrics?

options.text: d the sun comes like a god

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Sensation

questions.question: The following lyrics are from which 1972 hit: Its gonna be a bright, bright sunshiny day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I Can See Clearly Now

questions.question: What movie stars Elvis Presley as Pacer Burton, the son of a Kiowa mother and a Texas rancher father?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Flaming Star

questions.question: Sunshine go away today, I dont feel much like dancing is the opening line of which song by Jonathan Edwards?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sunshine

questions.question: Which of these was not among the presents Elvis Presley used to give to his friends and associates?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Guitars

questions.question: Which song by rock and roll group Tommy James and the Shondells includes the lyrics Look over yonder, what do you see? The sun is a rising most definitely?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Crystal Blue Persuasion

questions.question: Who was the entertainment impresario known best as the manager of Elvis Presley
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Colonel Tom Parker

questions.question: Which song from The Joshua Tree album contains the following lines?

options.text: Where the Streets Have No Name

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Where the Streets Have No Name

questions.question: The following lyrics are from which song by Tesla?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paradise

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Doors and Ozzy
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, report, death. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Jim Morrison, a poet, songwriter and lead singer of The Doors, was born on December 8, 1943 in which American state?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Florida

questions.question: Ozzy is a bat-winged demon crouching by a mushroom cloud
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Ultimate Sin

questions.question: Ozzy is a werewolf
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bark at the Moon

questions.question: Ozzy wears a crown of thorns; dirty children stand by his side
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No Rest for the Wicked

questions.question: Director Oliver Stone appeared  in his own movie, entitled The Doors.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What year were American rock band, The Doors inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1993

questions.question: This musician, author of the best-selling autobiography, Riders On The Storm, played the drums for The Doors.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Densmore

questions.question: Ozzy is depicted as an angel
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No More Tears

questions.question: What caused Jim Morrisons death according to the official report?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Heart Failure

questions.question: Who played the role of Jim Morrison in the 1991 film The Doors, directed by Oliver Stone?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Val Kilmer

questions.question: Which 1969 album by The Doors included  the single Touch Me, written by Robbie Krieger?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Soft Parade

questions.question: What year did lead singer of The Doors, Jim Morrison die?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1971

questions.question: A dead dove; an inverted cross; Ozzy in tattered bloody clothing
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Diary of A Madman

questions.question: The Doors were formed in Los Angeles, California in what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1965

questions.question: The album Waiting for the Sun, which includes the single Hello, I Love You, was released by The Doors in what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1968

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Member and Hits
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, steve, jackson. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Ozzys torso is covered with eyes and mouths.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ozzmosis

questions.question: Eric Carmen issued several hits as a solo artist including All By Myself and Hungry Eyes for the Dirty Dancing soundtrack. Before all this, Eric was a member of what power pop band?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Raspberries

questions.question: Peter Framptons incredible 1976 album Frampton Comes Alive featured the hit songs Do You Feel Like We Do? and Show Me the Way and made him a bona fide stadium-filling arena rocker. What band was he a member of before going solo?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Humble Pie

questions.question: Which one hit wonder had a huge hit in 1984 with the song Somebodys Watching Me?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rockwell

questions.question: Famous musical duos such as Hall  Oates, Ike  Tina, Sonny  Cher, and Simon  Garfunkle dont last forever.  Often one or both will seek solo fame, leaving the duo behind.  The singer-songwriter Kenny Loggins had a number of hits for the movies Caddyshack, Footloose, and Top Gun - but before all that, he was a member of a fairly popular duo called what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Loggins  Messina

questions.question: The song   The Warrior was a big hit for which group in 1984?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Scandal

questions.question: After leaving this alternative rock band in 1993 for a solo career, singer Natalie Merchant gained critical fame with a series of hits including Jealousy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 10,000 Maniacs

questions.question: Musician and singer Steve Winwood had hits with Back in the High Life, Higher Love and Roll With It as a solo artist, but produced perhaps his best music while a member of several musical groups. Which of these bands was Steve Winwood not a member of?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spirit

questions.question: This is the only Ozzy LP cover depicting a member of his backup band
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tribute

questions.question: Graffiti on a tan-colored wall
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Just Say Ozzy

questions.question: Todd Rundgren has had a successful career as a solo artist with hits like I Saw the Light, Hello Its Me, and Bang the Drum All Day.” Hes also been a successful producer, working with bands ranging from Hall  Oates to Grand Funk Railroad to XTC.  Todd left what Beatlesque garage-rock band in 1969 to go at it solo?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Nazz

questions.question: Jackson Browne, the popular singer-songwriter responsible for the hits Doctor My Eyes, Somebodys Baby for the Fast Times at Ridgemont High soundtrack, Running on Empty, and Take It Easy for the Eagles, was once a member of what country rock band?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nitty Gritty Dirt Band

questions.question: On how many of his album covers can you see the letters O-Z-Z-Y tattooed on his fingers
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 3

questions.question: Steve Perry had a monster hit with which solo single in 1984?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oh Sherrie

questions.question: Ozzy lying on a hardwood floor decked all in white, thrusting a crucifix into the air.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blizzard of Ozz

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Band and Member
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, composers, john. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In a well-known episode of the U.S. TV show The Brady Bunch, Greg Brady is spotted by a musical agent. Unfortunately, the agent doesnt want all the Bradys, only Greg. Subsequently, Greg leaves his brothers and sisters in the dust in favor of a solo career, and adopts a stage name. What is this stage name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johnny Bravo

questions.question: Danny Elfman is one of the leading film composers in the world with acclaimed compositions for dozens of movies including Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, Beetlejuice, Batman, Spiderman, and Charlottes Web.  Before his incredible success scoring films, Danny was a member of which new wave rock band?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oingo Boingo

questions.question: John Sebastian left this enormously influential group in 1968 for a solo career which yielded the number one single Welcome Back in 1976.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Lovin Spoonful

questions.question: Björk, the Icelandic singer and songwriter, has earned numerous Grammies, sold millions of albums, and has acted in major Hollywood movies. Before all the critical acclaim and media attention, Björk was once the lead vocalist for which alternative rock/pop band?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Sugarcubes

questions.question: Gary Wright, famous for his 1976 hit Dream Weaver, was a member of what rock group?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spooky Tooth

questions.question: Space Cowboy is a term used by The Steve Miller band. On what album did this term originally appear?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brave New World

questions.question: Mike Rutherford of the band Mike + The Mechanics, was also a founding member of what successful group?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Genesis

questions.question: Schoolboys in Disgrace was an album released in 1975 by what band?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Kinks

questions.question: Who was the drummer for the band Led Zeppelin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Bonham

questions.question: Eric Clapton is one of the most successful musicians of the 20th century.  His career has spanned several decades, and is often considered the greatest guitarist of all time. What band was Clapton not a member of before going solo?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Traffic

questions.question: With five number one singles in the 1980s, singer/songwriter Lionel Ritchie has had Billboard chart successes that most musicians can only dream of. Before all this, however, Lionel experienced similar success with this soul/funk group.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Commodores

questions.question: Gram Parsons was a very talented songwriter who died in the early 70s. Which of the following bands did he not play for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Poco

questions.question: The Summer Jam at Watkins Glen, a concert in 1973, was attended by more people than Woodstock (1969). Who were the only three bands that played?

options.text: Crosby, Stills, Nash  Young, The Allman Brothers and the Grateful Dead
The Who, the Eagles and Ten Years After
The Band, The Allman Brothers and the Grateful Dead
The Rolling Stones, the Who and Jefferson Airplane

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Band, The Allman Brothers and the Grateful Dead

questions.question: What band performed the 1978 song Wheel In The Sky?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Journey

questions.question: The Grateful Dead performed at the famous ill-fated 1969 Altamont concert.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Level 42

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Bono, Sade, Cher, Prince, Sting... several bands have lead singers with only one name. Which 1980s new wave bands lead singer was called only by the name Limahl?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kajagoogoo

questions.question: What 1980s new wave band had one of their early videos banned from the BBC and heavily edited by MTV for pornographic content in 1981?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Duran Duran

questions.question: This pop singing sensation had one of the biggest hit songs of 2007 with Umbrella.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rihanna

questions.question: What 80s band performed the 1989 smash hit 18 and Life?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Skid Row

questions.question: What RB group had a huge  #2 hit song with Neither One of Us (Wants to be the First to Say Goodbye)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gladys Knight  the Pips

questions.question: Which of these bands performed the 1978 song Sultans of Swing?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dire Straits

questions.question: AC/DC sang the 1987 hit Night Train.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which of these bands performed the 1973 song Free Ride?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Edgar Winter Group

questions.question: The stylish 1980s new wave group ABC, which is responsible for such hits as Poison Arrow, Be Near Me and The Look of Love, also put out this classic new wave album.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lexicon of Love

questions.question: Who brought us the song Im Eighteen?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alice Cooper

questions.question: In 1963, this teen pop star became the youngest solo artist ever to have a #1 song in the United States.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stevie Wonder

questions.question: When this 1980s new wave Goth band broke up, the lead singer Peter Murphy went solo and produced the hit Cuts You Up. The rest of the band went on to form the popular group Love and Rockets. What was the name of the initial 1980s new wave band?
